A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Grew up on Star Wars in the 80s and expected this episode to be raw like.the last. It was not.

First the uncharacteristic aspects of the movie that did not sit well when looking at the Star Wars anthology. The overuse of light slapstick comedy detracted from the storyline. The easy and quick deaths of Snoke and Phasma were disappointing due to the buildup of both characters since the last movie. Benicio's character could have been further developed instead of having a Disney Alladin villain feel. The casino planet reminded me of the overuse of cheesy characters and scenes in the prequel movies. Superman Leia flying through space seemed out of place for a Star Wars movie. Ren/Rey telepathic FaceTime was exaggerated and felt forced after a while. 

Loved several aspects of the movie. Rebellion captain\, Rose and her sister were bad ass. However\, Rose disrupting Finn's attempt to fly into the cannon\, took away from maybe the most powerful scene in the movie. Luke's hermit ways and then coming back to kick ass via transcendental meditation. Rey/Ren battling Snoke guards. The salt battle scene was amazing. 

Left the theater unsatisfied and longing the raw Star Wars feel that this movie lacked.
